intro: Harpalyce moana, commonly known as the Pacific harpalyce, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the Leguminosae family, which is characterized by its pod fruits and nitrogen-fixing capabilities. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to saline and sandy soils. Its leaves are trifoliate, with three leaflets that are often hairy. The flowers are small and usually pale in color, contributing to its ecological role in stabilizing coastal dunes.
